overview.summary: Apply an interpolant field to project the data from one field onto the mesh of another field.

description.p: This module interpolates the "Source" field onto the geometry of the Interpolant field. The Interpolant field would be preconstructed using the module.

The source field for and ApplyInterpolant must contain the same geometry and data locations. However they do not have to contain the same data values or value types. For instance, a TetVolField of doubles with data at the nodes can be passed into the Source port of , and a TetVolField of Vectors with data also at the nodes and with the same mesh can be passed into the source port of ApplyInterpolant.

should be used instead of and ApplyInterpolant if the Interpolant is not to be reused, as it does the same interpolation without building the intermediate interpolant field. This should be used if the source field changes much more often than the destination field.

net.title: ApplyInterpolant Regression Test
net.p: Build an interpolant from an input field onto a plane, and then use ApplyInterpolant to apply the data from the input field back to the interpolant field.

Note that the same thing could be done by replacing both and ApplyInterpolant with a module. ApplyInterpolate was meant primarily to be used in conjunction with loops and time dependent data, such that the interpolant field could be computed once and then applied multiple times.
This network can be found at src/nets/Modules/FieldsData/ApplyInterpolant.net.
